OSC Start and Stop

OSC Start and Stop defines.

OSC Start and Stop defines to be used with am_hal_clkgen_osc_x().

#define AM_HAL_RTC_OSC_XT   0x0
 

RTC Interrupts

Macro definitions for RTC interrupt status bits.

These macros correspond to the bits in the RTC interrupt status register. They may be used with any of the am_hal_rtc_int_x() functions.

#define AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM   RTC_INTEN_ALM_Msk
 

RTC Alarm Repeat Interval.

Macro definitions for the RTC alarm repeat interval.

These macros correspond to the RPT bits in the RTCCTL register. They may be used with the am_hal_rtc_alarm_interval_set() function.

Note: AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_10TH and AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_100TH do not correspond to the RPT bits but are used in conjunction with setting the ALM100 bits in the ALMLOW register.

#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_DIS   0x0
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_YR   0x1
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_MTH   0x2
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_WK   0x3
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_DAY   0x4
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_HR   0x5
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_MIN   0x6
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_SEC   0x7
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_10TH   0x8
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_100TH   0x9
 

RTC Alarm 100 Interval.

Macro definitions for the RTC alarm ms intervals.

These macros are used inside the am_hal_rtc_alarm_interval_set function when 10ms and 100ms repeated alarm intervals are desired.

#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM100_DEFAULT   0x00
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM100_10TH   0xF0
 
#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM100_100TH   0xFF

Typedef Documentation

◆ am_hal_rtc_time_t

typedef struct am_hal_rtc_time_struct am_hal_rtc_time_t

The basic time structure used by the HAL for RTC interaction.

All values are positive whole numbers. The HAL routines convert back and forth to BCD.

Function Documentation

Get the Real Time Clock Alarm Parameters.

Note
Gets the RTC's Alarm time
Parameters

◆ am_hal_rtc_alarm_interval_set()

void am_hal_rtc_alarm_interval_set ( uint32_t  ui32RepeatInterval)

Sets the alarm repeat interval.

Sets the alarm repeat interval.

Parameters
ui32RepeatInterval

the desired repeat interval.

Valid values for ui32RepeatInterval: 

- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_DIS
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_YR
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_MTH
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_WK
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_DAY
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_HR
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_MIN
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_SEC
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_10TH
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_100TH

Set the Real Time Clock Alarm Parameters.

Parameters
*pTime- A pointer to the time structure.

Valid values for ui32RepeatInterval: 
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_DIS
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_YR
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_MTH
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_WK
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_DAY
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_HR
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_MIN
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_SEC
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_10TH
- AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_EVERY_100TH

Returns

◆ am_hal_rtc_int_set()

void am_hal_rtc_int_set ( uint32_t  ui32Interrupt)

Sets the selected RTC interrupts.

Sets the RTC interrupts causing them to immediately trigger.

Parameters
ui32Interrupt

desired interrupts

ui32Interrupt should be the following: 

AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM

◆ am_hal_rtc_int_status_get()

uint32_t am_hal_rtc_int_status_get ( bool  bEnabledOnly)

Returns the RTC interrupt status.

Returns the RTC interrupt status.

Parameters
bEnabledOnly- return the status of only the enabled interrupts.
Returns
Bitwise representation of the current interrupt status. The return value will be 0 or the following:
  • AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM

◆ am_hal_rtc_osc_disable()

Stops the RTC oscillator.

◆ am_hal_rtc_osc_enable()

void am_hal_rtc_osc_enable ( void  )

Enable/Start the RTC oscillator.

Starts the RTC oscillator.

◆ am_hal_rtc_osc_select()

void am_hal_rtc_osc_select ( uint32_t  ui32OSC)

Selects the clock source for the RTC.

This function selects the clock source for the RTC.

Parameters
ui32OSCThe clock source for the RTC.
Valid values for ui32OSC are: 
- AM_HAL_RTC_OSC_XT
Note
After selection of the RTC oscillator, a 2 second delay occurs before the new setting is reflected in status. Therefore the CLKGEN.STATUS.OMODE bit will not reflect the new status until after the 2s wait period.

◆ am_hal_rtc_time_12hour()

void am_hal_rtc_time_12hour ( bool  b12Hour)

Configures the RTC for 12 or 24 hour time keeping.

Configures the RTC for 12 (true) or 24 (false) hour time keeping.

Parameters
b12Hour- A 'true' configures the RTC for 12 hour time keeping.

◆ am_hal_rtc_time_get()

uint32_t am_hal_rtc_time_get ( am_hal_rtc_time_t *  pTime)

Get the Real Time Clock current time.

Gets the RTC's current time

Parameters
*pTime- A pointer to the time structure to store the current time.
Returns
0 for success and 1 for error.

◆ am_hal_rtc_time_set()

uint32_t am_hal_rtc_time_set ( am_hal_rtc_time_t *  pTime)

Set the Real Time Clock counter registers.

Sets the RTC counter registers to the supplied values.

Parameters
*pTime- A pointer to the time structure.
